element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text:
The technique known as Ordered Weighted Average (OWA) calculates the weighted average of a group of layers. The weighting, however, is not done with fixed weights for each layer. Instead, they are set based on the order of values.
Thus, for each cell, values from all layers are sorted and the highest one is multiplied by a given coefficient, the second highest by another, and so on. The weights are associated to a position within the sorted series of values in each cell, not to one particular layer.

element.name: WEIGHTS
element.text: add values of weighted average for the group of selected layers.
